text: See, my wife and I have totally different taste in movies
and she sends me down to Red Box anyway.
“Get something we both like.”
(guffaws)
"You better pack a sandwich honey,
I’m gonna be a while."
When I walked up there was no line,
but about 10 minutes later,
I’m like going back; people are lining up behind.
I’m looking to them,
I’m like, “Sorry, man.
You guys know is there anything
where a bunch of people fight
and explode and then they cry about it and talk?"
There’s nothing, right?
Two hours later, she’s asleep on the couch
and I’m sitting there watching The Notebook,
by myself. And I’m liking it.
Marriage has turned me into a wuss.
It’s like a one-way ticket on the Wuss Express.
"You take this woman to be your lawfully wedded wife?"
"All aboard… wuss, wuss."
Shhh… wussah, wussah, wussah, wussah,
wussah, wussah, wussah, wussah.
"If you look out to your right, you’ll see a man apologizing
for something he didn’t even do."
(Laughter)
(Laughter and Applause)
It’s like a reflex. Sometimes I’m alone in the room
it just pops out,
"Sorry!
Sorry!  Sorry! Sorry!  Sorry!"
She’s up in the kitchen. "For what?"
"Just in general. Wuss wuss!
Since I didn’t do anything, can I build up a credit?"
I wish. I need a credit to get out of shopping.
I got no business in that store.
My entire job; hold the purse, hold the jacket,
look like a dork. Wuss, wuss.
It’s not so bad when I’m with her.
You everlose her and still have the stuff?
"Honey?
It’s not funny."
"We have a lost husband on aisle three.
He wants his mommy."
I can’t shop with her; I turn into a seven-year-old.
My knees get weak,
“Honey, can we go?
You said it was just gonna be one thing.
Come on!
I wanna go home!”
Then she starts treating me like a kid,
“You’re just tired.”
“I’m not tired.”
“Do you want a time out?”
“No.”
She actually told me once to stay near the cart.
Right in front of somebody, too.
And I did.
Thank God he was married.
I could tell. He looked at me like,
“Hey, you don’t have to explain nothing, man.
You better stay down, she still looks pissed.”
